COMMENT_TX: The start of the game was delayed while players gathered around the plate. Baskets of flowers were presented to Mgr Rickey and Clarence Mueller. Mayor Kiel then tossed three wide ones to catcher Herman Bader and the game was on. In the stands were 150 Red rooters here from Cincinnati to see their pets play ball.
Bohne tried to advance on Ainsmith's overthrow
Slow roller that Pinelli guessed would roll foul
Great throw nailed Roush by inches. Roush protested vigorously on Ump Moran's decision.
Umpire Moran walked over to the Reds' bench and ejected Wingo for too hectic chatter.
Guess, based on box scores. Box score assists: Ainsmith=1 Box score BBs: off Pfeffer=2, off Donohue=2
Lavan started at 3B for Stock who was hit in the nose by a batted ball in practice today and put on the hospital list.
Maranville momentarily fumbled but threw to Grimm for what looked like a putout.  Ump Pfirman called the runner safe bringing a strong protest from the Pirates.
1-handed circus catch; Myers fell as he made the grab
Fine stop but the ball fell out of his grasp
Tierney should've taken 2 bases on it but he stopped at 1B
Russell's fast fielding held it to a single
Box score POs: Blades=1, Stock=2; assists: Traynor=1
Good fielding by Bigbee held Flack to a single
Maranville juggled what could've been a DP
Poorly played by Schmidt, but Myers credited with a hit
Carey strained his back while attempting to catch the ball and he required first aid.  After a short rest he remained in the game.
Caught near the flagpole and LCF bleachers.  Ainsmith had failed to bunt just before this wallop.
Slashed a wicked liner off Kunz' left leg, the ball rolling toward 1B.
Pfeffer dozed on the return throw and was caught off 2B in a rundown. SLS: ...2X2(845)
Sensational 1-handed catch near the fence to rob Bigbee of an extra base hit.
It began to sprinkle as the Cards came to bat
Box scores reported Russell with an assist today
The former Cardinal got a hand when he came to the plate
With a 3-2 count, Grantham fouled off 8 straight pitches before hitting the ball off Haines' glove to Hornsby.
First strikeout this season for Hornsby
Perfect bunt past the pitcher; fielded by Grimes but nobody covered 1B.
Dropped a single back of 2B on hit & run
Grimes suffered an injury to his spine sliding into 3B last inning.  It was believed he dislocated a vertebrae which gave him much trouble last year and during this spring.
Fine catch to RCF fence, robbing Bottomley of extra bases
In the rundown, Hornsby and Bottomley both occupied 3B. SLS: ...1X3(5215)
Wonderful play by Stock who dived headlong to stop the smash, then threw to 2B while still on the ground.
Fine catch of low line drive
Alexander has now thrown 34 consecutive IP without a BB
$Clemons was hurt by a foul tip and had to leave the game.
Roush fell as he tried to field it
Between innings, McKechnie was ejected by Ump Hart for continuing his protest of the go-ahead run.
Dyer twisted his ankle in yesterday's game, and Flack was on the sick list with a severe cold.
Remarkable stop of a short hit to his left
Awarded a hit when Parkinson and McCurdy collided trying for the pop fly.
SLS: S.1-H, but all box scores credited a triple
Freigau was still out of the lineup, his left arm having been put in a plaster cast. Cy Williams' back injury yesterday prevented him from playing in today's game.
Weinert deflected it, robbing Ainsmith of a hit
Caught near the grandstand after a long run
Hornsby went to 3B coaching line to watch Toporcer walk
Aided by a bad and late throw by McCurdy
The Frenchman was given a fine hand when he came to bat
Hit RF wall, but fast fielding held it to a single
Hit in the head. He took time out, and after a short rest, resumed play.
Ran toward flagpole to pull down lusty wallop
Smash bounded off Grimes toward 1B line
Deflected off Grimes' glove; High's throw to 1B was low
Bottomley: Leaping catch of Lavan's throw
Grimes tried a quick-pitch but Sherdel singled
Sherdel was picked off 1B but Johnston dropped the throw
Fine stop and throw robbed Flack of hit
Wide throw. Hornsby was given a splendid reception as he stepped to the plate (he had been out of the lineup with a knee injury since 5/25).
Beat out infield hit past Oeschger
Reached out and caught the foul near the pavilion
Robbed of extra-base hit when Southworth dashed down and got his wallop.
McInnis didn't even try for it
Liner went through Boeckel, but Smith recovered in time. Assist to Boeckel?
Wonderful, leaping stop of high bounder
During the AB, Ainsmith stepped out of the box because Oeschger was so deliberate in his pitching.  Ump O'Day made Oeschger pitch and called a strike on Ainsmith.
McInnis protested Ump Moran's decision at 1B

Start time delayed over an hour due to 9th annual St Louis Tuberculosis Society benefit baseball game and carnival. Hornsby received a telegram today that his mother was ill in Fort Worth, Texas.  She had been ailing for some months.
The crowd roared a welcome to Hornsby as he came to bat.  He responded with a ball that hit the top of the pavilion and bounced over to Grand Boulevard.
Remarkable catch of a drive headed for the flagpole
Great catch close to the crowd
Masterly play by Lavan who leaped for the high throw then came down on Smith for the out.
Wonderful stop of tough bounder behind 2B
Myers beat the throw to 1B with a headlong slide
Robbed of hit in back of 2B
Fillingim replaced with 3-0 count, but box scores reported only 1 BB by him (and Genewich with 2).
Guessing Sherdel inserted in #2 lineup spot
The Cardinals presented a makeshift infield as Bottomley was forced to remain idle because of an infected right arm, and Hornsby was called to Texas because of the serious illness of his mother.
The game was halted while O'Day ran a Boston battery down in the bull pen out of the park.  The two Boston players had taken seats in the temporary box section in RF and had refused to vacate.
BG reported no run scoring until Smith's single
Stuart wheeled and got Smith off 2B
Robbed of a hit by Lavan's backhanded catch
$It began to rain as Groh threw out Stock
Ainsmith had O'Connell easily between 3B and home but made a useless throw to Stock and O'Connell beat the return peg.
Blades backed up against LF fence for a startling catch of Kelly's terrific drive.  It was a great effort robbed Kelly of HR.
Stock threw low in foolish attempt to double Kelly.  Kelly touched 1B and advanced to 2B.  The Cardinals protested the decision and Stock was ejected by Ump Pfirman.
Robbed of a hit; 'Flack dashed down to RCF after a lusty drive.'
To the flagpole; great try by Statz but failed to hold on
SLS: Popped over Toporcer CDN: S/G6.3-H  [bounced over Toporcer]
Fine catch of husky drive to LF bleachers
One of the fastest DPs seen on the local lot this season
Grantham thought pop was caught and ran back to 1B

$Pitcher Toney thought SS Toporcer should have knocked down ball hit by Heathcote and they argued; Toporcer took off his glasses and the two preared to fight, but were separated by umpire Wilson; Toney left vountarily for a pinch-hittier in the bottom of the inning
Carey's speed was a big factor
Guessing fielders; Hornsby was run down between 1B and 2B
Bigbee made a thrilling pickup of Hornsby's mad liner. Smith thought he had made a shoestring catch and sprinted back to 1B. Bigbee, who had fallen in making the play, arose and threw him out at 2B.
It was thought that Grimm was pulled off the bag and the decision started a protest.  When play resumed, Rabbit apparently worked the hidden ball trick on Hornsby but it was not allowed.
Traynor threw wide to Rawlings at 2B
Freigau was caught up the line, expecting a bunt
Box score POs: Bottomley=8, Stock=4, Toporcer=3, Blades=6
Beautiful 1-hand stop in deep SS, but threw late to 3B
Stole while Haines held the ball
Fast play; great pickup by Bottomley of low throw
Delayed steal while Haines held the ball
Fine pickup by Stock; neat scoop by Bottomley of low throw
Freigau reached for a high one
Hornsby tagged Rawlings on the line
PGT claimed he tried to bunt for a hit
Maranville collided with Ainsmith allowing Flack's throw to bound to the stands.
During Hornsby's AB, Ump Klem held up the game for a few minutes while he lectured Hamilton about the evils of soiling the ball. He allowed him to continue to pitch, however.
Stock tried to catch the infield playing back
Temperature was cooler than the three preceding afternoons Slow field from a storm early in the morning PGT: 92 minutes
$Lavan had to hold up to see if Mokan would catch it.  Sand recovered and threw home in time to catch Lavan.
Fine recovery by Hornsby after Bottomley knocked down the roller; Haines covered 1B.
Henline did not advance on infield hit
Box score POs: Bottomley=6, Ainsmith=8;  Assists: Tierney=3
Fournier was given a great hand when he stepped to the plate
Wonderful backhanded stop and fine toss
Box scores reported just one T.Griffith double
Mueller thought pop would be caught
Delayed steal when DeBerry 'rolled the ball back to the pitcher.'
Bottomley leaped high and to his right; robbed of double
Box scores reported no Fournier double
Running catch Box score Assists: Pfeffer=5
Bottomley had an easy play at 3B but his throw pulled Stock off bag.  Stock tried to get French at 2B but threw into RF.
Nice catch of foul; Griffith credited with sac in box scores
Roller took a freak hop over French; Bailey fumbled
The ball glanced off Hornsby's glove into RF.  He recovered and with a fine throw got Neis trying to score. Neis hurt his leg.
Bottomley reached into the temporary stands in RF
The bunt did not advance Toporcer
Robbed of extra base hit; 1-hand running catch of the vicious line drive.
French went after a slow ball
Off Sherdel's glove; he recovered but threw wild
Box scores reported no strikeout by Dickerman
Assist total differs from TSN for Stock.
Box scores didn't report this DP
Attempted double steal Mueller protested strongly against the decision and was ejected by Ump Pfirman.
Toney took the tap with his bare hand
The ball slipped out of Couch's hand as he began his delivery.
Assist totals differ from TSN for Flowers, Freigau.
Les Bell's ML debut (previously believed to be 9/18/23)
ML debut for SS Les Bell (SLN)
A light rain began when Kelly went to the plate
Clemons muffed Freigau's throw to the plate
Stock knocked down hot bounder and tagged Nehf
Pop fly fell safely when Bell and Stock collided, but Stock recovered in time to force Meusel.
Pop fly fell between Youngs and Frisch
Guessing fielders; Stock was trapped off 2B but returned safely while Bell was tagged out during the rundown.
Good catch by Fournier of French's throw
Box scores reported no Stock double
Through Stock; Smith let the ball go through him
